case_vignette: A sexually active 37-year-old man comes to the physician because of a 7-day history of itching in the area of his genitals! He also reports burning on micturition! He has type 2 diabetes mellitus, which is well controlled with oral metformin! Pelvic examination shows tender, atrophic white papules on the glans and prepuce, with erythema of the surrounding skin! The urinary meatus is narrowed and sclerotic!
question: Which  is the most appropriate next step in diagnosis?

trial_0.vignette_frq: Perform a biopsy of the lesions.

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing itching in my genital area and a burning sensation when I urinate.
Have you noticed any discharge or rash in the genital area?
Yes, there are tender white spots on the head of my genitals and the skin around it is red.
Have you had any recent new sexual partners or unprotected sex?
I am sexually active, but the details regarding new partners or unprotected sex aren't specified.
Do you have any history of similar symptoms in the past?
No, I haven't had similar symptoms in the past.
Do you have any known allergies or are you currently taking any medications?
I am taking oral metformin for my well-controlled type 2 diabetes mellitus, but no known allergies are mentioned.
Final Diagnosis: Genital herpes.
